summary: An FBI Crisis Intake report documenting a tip received on July 8, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The caller, a former employee of a New York store, reported suspicious behavior by Epstein in 1999, including purchasing items for alleged 'nieces' and being seen with young girls. The report suggests a store in Sarasota, FL, may hold relevant purchase records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the FBI intake report. A former client of a New York store, reported for suspicious behavior involving purchases for young girls he called his 'nieces'.

events.title: Epstein's Suspicious Store Visits
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was a client at a store in New York, where he would purchase items for his alleged 'nieces' but was evasive when questioned about them. He was also seen walking by the store with young girls.

events.title: FBI Tip Received on Epstein
events.description: An individual called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to provide information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and potential child sex trafficking, triggering this crisis intake report.

locations: New York, NY (store location where Epstein was a client in 1999)
St. Armand's Circle, Sarasota, FL (location of a store that may hold Epstein's purchase records)
keyFacts: An FBI crisis intake was filed on July 8, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein and child sex trafficking.
The tipster, a former store employee, reported Epstein was a client in 1999 and made purchases for alleged 'nieces' but was evasive about them.
The tipster recalled seeing Epstein walk by the store with young girls who appeared to be in their late teens and did not believe they were his nieces.
The report indicates a store in Sarasota, Florida, may possess Epstein's historical purchase records.
The caller's identity is protected in the document; no named witness is provided beyond the subject, Jeffrey Epstein.
